text: oduuf kan muddame hadhaa isaa daandii irraatti gargaraa.
meaning: Engaging in gossip often distracts from more important responsibilities or tasks.
transliteration: He who rushes for gossip helps his mother in the middle of the road.

text: Amo Akwasi ba ne wo a, wokyiri ntakraboa.
meaning: Taboos go in families, if you belong to a family you accept its norms.
transliteration: If you are Amo Akwasi’s child, a bird to you is a taboo.

text: ሀሰተኛ ሲናገር ይታወቃል በሶ ሲበሉት ያንቃል
meaning: Skill in one area does not guarantee skill in another.
transliteration: He has been known to speak eloquently, and he chokes when he eats it.

text: To gi’ehi tufi, ɗon fuccitetee
meaning: Removing pain through another pain
transliteration: Where the thorn enters, is the place to prick

text: Tajiri, Mai ruwan sha.
meaning: The rich live in bounty
transliteration: A wealthy man has drinking water

text: Ihe e nyere nwa agbọghọ dịka akwa e jiri lie ozu; ozu amaghị na a chinyere ya akwa, akwa agaghị erukwa onye nwe ya aka ọzọ
meaning: A person that has been helped cannot show concern
transliteration: What was given to a girl is like a cloth that is used to bury a corpse, a corpse does not know that they gave him a cloth, the cloth cannot get back to the owner

text: Amafutha awaphelile.
meaning: There's still time to make things right.
transliteration: The oil is not finished.

text: Izanze kuba izawe uziburana na nyirazo
meaning: What is not meant for you will never be yours. It encourages people to let go
transliteration: What refused to be your own, you argue about it with the owner

text: Matusi ni pumba ya uwongo, halikai neno la uongo
meaning: lies do not have any lasting power.
transliteration: Words of abuse are [like throwing] a handful of mud. A word of slander does not stay

text: Bisous bisous alobaki etelemaka, azali kofanda na ndako.
meaning: Know your limits. Connaissez vos limites.
transliteration: The swallow said stop, it stays at home. L'hirondelle a dit stop, elle reste à la maison.

text: Kanyenye kotsakatika, gondo roonekwa rakaruma nyama.
meaning: People are often suspicious of coincidences that seem to provide answers to a mystery.
transliteration: A lamb or kid goes missing, an eagle is seen biting meat.

text: Dabayshii dhulkii hawada la isku hayaan.
meaning: Nature's balance and interconnectedness.
transliteration: The roots of the earth are nourished by the air.

text: Ndoxum kesseh du forohh.
meaning: Keeping the right company keeps you on the right path.
transliteration: Water alone will not be sour.

text: Kudala ngimubona lo nto.
meaning: It implies foresight or prior knowledge about a situation or event.
transliteration: I've seen this thing a long time ago.

text: A ní kó múwá, ó ní kò sí; ahun ni lójú alágbe.
meaning: People are often unmindful of the fact that other people have their own problems.
transliteration: He is asked for alms and says he has nothing to give; to the beggar he appears as a miser.

text: Yeroo ati kaatee falmtu abbaan murtii si loogaa,osoo teessee maaltu ta'a?
meaning: Arguing openly can lead to bias, so sometimes it's better to be passive.
transliteration: When you stand up and argue, the judge discriminates against you; what if you sit down?

text: Sekyerɛ akokɔnini abankwa se; ‘"Deɛ ɛbɛyɛ me ara na anya ayɛ me yi.’’
meaning: No worse can happen than that which has already occurred, so you have nothing further to fear.
transliteration: There Sekyere cock (which stretches its neck out) says; "The worst has already happened to me".

text: የምንወደውም ነገር አለን።
meaning: Asserts the worth or importance of one's possessions or values.
transliteration: We also have something we cherish.

text: Hiinde defata welko
meaning: A person who has been doing a work for long performs better
transliteration: An old pot cooks nice soup

text: Magana zarar bunu ce
meaning: You can't take back spoken words
transliteration: Words are like pulling straws from thatch

text: Isi kotara ebu ka ebu na agba
meaning: He that goes on to look for trouble should be able to face the consequences
transliteration: If the head disturbs the wasp, the wasp will sting

text: Owesifazane uyajabula ngokuthula, hhayi ngokumemeza.
meaning: True happiness comes from within and does not seek attention or validation from others.
transliteration: A woman rejoices in silence, not in shouting.

text: Igiti uzatema ushaje, ugitera ukiri muto.
meaning: It is important to plan for the future ahead of time
transliteration: It is at a young age that you plant the tree you will cut in old age

text: Kwenye vilio, patakiwe ni wewe.
meaning: Being a source of comfort or support during difficult times.
transliteration: In the midst of crying, you are the one needed.

text: Moto moko asimbaki motema na ye kati na ezalela moko ya mpasi, abandaki kokima mbangu.
meaning: Emotions can trigger action. Les émotions peuvent déclencher des actions.
transliteration: A person touched his heart in a difficult situation, he started running. Une personne a touché son cœur dans une situation difficile, elle a commencé à courir.

text: Ishungu dzemutana aswera padare kuramba nemhandire seane mazino.
meaning: Denying others access to something that one cannot use.
transliteration: It is the meanness of an old man who spent a day at a meeting place to deny others hardened maize cobs as if he has teeth.

text: Ninkii dumarka kaga cafiyo, naagana kala sooc doonaa.
meaning: Warns against mistreatment and advocates for justice and equality.
transliteration: The man who mistreats women will face consequences, and a woman will retaliate.

text: Dëmm rey la, jaale la
meaning: Beware of people who pose as friends but are actually your enemies.
transliteration: The witch kills you and then comes to offer her condolences.

text: Uyababonisa, bafuna enye into.
meaning: It warns against greed and dissatisfaction.
transliteration: You show them and they want something else.

text: Ọmọ olóko ònírìn lórí ebè
meaning: Someone who understands the value of something and has a stake in its preservation will take care not to destroy it.
transliteration: The farm owner's child will not walk on the farm ridges, only the furrows.

text: Abbaafi dhugaa dha waan nyaatu dhabe ayyoof dhugaa dha waan kennitu dhabde
meaning: A just judgement
transliteration: My father in truth lacks something to eat; my mother in truth lacks something to give.

text: Apatuprɛ kɔsi mako so na ɔtete bi di na wɔbisa no sɛ; “Adɛn nti na woreyɛ soeɛ-soeɛ?” Ose: “Efirisɛ merememene amu-amu ntira”.
meaning: A stupid question requires a stupid answer.
transliteration: If the bulbul perches on the pepper plant and pecks some to eat and you ask it: “Why are you crying thus:-soe-soe?” it replies: “Because I swallowed a pepper whole”.

text: ወንዙ ፈጽሞ አይደርቅም።
meaning: Certain things remain constant despite changes around them.
transliteration: The river never dries up.

text: No sammeere mawniri fuu,to ƴommbal nde ƴiwoy
meaning: That one should not ignore his origin
transliteration: No matter how big a head of guinea corn is, it is from a cornstalk

text: Sabo da yi, baki ya je gidan mutuwa, ya ce barka
meaning: Out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks
transliteration: Being used to it, the mouth went to a mourning house and said may this repeat itself.

text: Onye bu ụzọ siwe ite na-ebu ụzọ enwe mkpọmkpọ ite.
meaning: There is a consequence to every action
transliteration: The earlier you begin cooking, the earlier your pot wears out.

text: Isihlahla sitshalwa lapho sokhula khona.
meaning: Suggests that everyone has their own unique talents and abilities, and they should be placed in environments where they can thrive and prosper.
transliteration: A plant is put where it will grow best.

text: Ikirema ni ikiri mu nda
meaning: As long as a child is born, they have a purpose and they will serve that. No one is useless.
transliteration: A disabled person is the one is not born yet.

text: Akili ni nyenzo
meaning: Knowledge is a valuable asset that can help people achieve their goals and improve their lives.
transliteration: Knowledge is power.

text: Bato bakutanaka na makambo na bango moko.
meaning: Everyone has their own experiences. Tout le monde a ses propres expériences.
transliteration: People have their own experiences. Les gens ont leurs propres expériences.

text: Afirwa haatariswe kumeso.
meaning: An encouragement to people to use appropriate register in difficult situations.
transliteration: The bereaved should not be looked into the face.

text: Ninkii isaga hayo gooco, dhiig baa loo cuniyo.
meaning: Warns against harming oneself and emphasizes the consequences of one's actions.
transliteration: One who has a wound on his hand, blood is tasted.

text: Meima ken munut seh deka.
meaning: Be self reliant.
transliteration: One cannot live on begging.

text: Ukuba ulutsha lukhulu, uyabona, uyakhuluma, uxolela.
meaning: Youthfulness is associated with openness, perceptiveness, and forgiveness.
transliteration: If you are young, you see, speak, forgive.

text: Ìti ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ ò ní ká má fi òun ṣe òpó ilé, ẹni tó máa gbé ilé ọ̀hún lominú má a kọ
meaning: Some things have limited use
transliteration: The plantain stem has no qualm being used as a house pillar; it's the potential occupants of the house that would be wary

text: Miciree fi sanyiin uraa qambarriin miliqa.
meaning: New growth (embryo and seeds) is often resilient and avoids obstacles (stick of the cabbage).
transliteration: The embryo and seeds escape the stick of the cabbage.

text: Anadwo gyatoɔ mu nni biribi a, ɛwɔ: “Da bi na meteeɛ”.
meaning: Every situation brings its own advantages.
transliteration: If the warming of oneself at night has nothing else, at least it has: “I heard it one day”.

text: እንቁራሪት ከሩቅ ውሃ አይጠጣም.
meaning: Don't expect someone who is distant or indifferent to suddenly show affection or care.
transliteration: A frog does not drink water from afar.

text: To woodi ko hoore nafirta fuuna, woodi ko pooɓe nafirta hirna
meaning: Everything has its own value
transliteration: If the head is good to east, then the buttocks are good to west

text: Bakin bunu, bata baibaya.
meaning: Something unequal, that is not smooth
transliteration: The tip of a thatch cannot be tamed.

text: Memi mekwụrụ adịghị ada ụka.
meaning: Revenge is not cheating.
transliteration: Revenge is not cheating.

text: Uyazi ngokudla kwakhe
meaning: One's actions reveal their true intentions or character
transliteration: He knows by its eating

text: Ibiheri bihera mu nzu, isuku isuka hanze
meaning: Self-reflection is necessary to improve oneself
transliteration: Bed bugs start inside and hygiene throws them out

text: Nguo za ndani hazionyeshwi barabarani.
meaning: Some matters are meant to be kept private.
transliteration: Inner clothes are not displayed in public.

text: Alobi ndako ya mobali na ye.
meaning: The depth of understanding, emotional connection, and intimacy between individuals.
transliteration: He knows the house of his owner's heart.

text: Muzivi wenzira yeparuware ndiye mufambi wayo
meaning: Let those who are more experienced in doing something show the way.
transliteration: One who knows a foot path over a flat rock surface is its frequent user.

text: Haddaan u ogolayn, waa inaan oggolayn.
meaning: I will only obey or listen if I choose to do so willingly.
transliteration: If I have listened, it's because I want to listen.

text: Ba ngai sane poj, poj a la njeka sane.
meaning: I knew what you were about to do before you did it.
transliteration: Poj saw you before you saw poj.

text: Ukunyathela isilonda kweli lizwe.
meaning: It suggests a commitment to addressing social injustices or grievances.
transliteration: Bandaging the wound of this country.

text: Abẹ́ igi tí àá sinmi sí, a kì í gé ẹ́ka rẹ̀
meaning: Think before you act; have a strategic perspective
transliteration: One shouldn't cut off the branches of a tree, in whose shade one would rest

text: Mo'attanis mo'adhaa, duutanis du'aa.
meaning: Embrace success or failure with equal commitment and resilience.
transliteration: Win if you win, and die if you die.

text: Wo nsa da mu a, yɛnni nnya wo.
meaning: You can't be left out when you are part of the core team.
transliteration: If your hand is in the dish, we don't eat and left you out.

text: የምታበረታታ ሴት እንደ ወርቅ ነች።
meaning: Acknowledging the preciousness of encouraging women.
transliteration: A woman who encourages is like gold.

text: Luttanaaɗo nyiiri tikkantaa longere
meaning: One must appreciate the little one has
transliteration: A person with leftover food must not be annoyed by a morsel

text: Ina laifin gwaiwa, ba ta ciwo?
meaning: If something doesn't bother you, leave it alone
transliteration: Where is the fault of hernia if it is not painful?

text: Ọ na-abụ e sekarịa ụtá, ihe a ga-agba efelaga.
meaning: Waisteful and careless planning can occasion mismanagement and failure.
transliteration: Waisting much time in drawing the bow before shooting may provide the opportunity for the target to escape.

text: Ithole elikhulu litholakala noma lilahlekile.
meaning: A great talent or ability will eventually be recognized.
transliteration: A large calf is found even if it's lost.

text: Akaryoshe kataye imbeba munsi y'ibuye
meaning: What is seductive or tempting can lead to destruction. It is used to people who like to participate in the events that their partners are not interested in.
transliteration: What is sweet left the cat under a stone

text: Oa mbuzi utaona pembe.
meaning: Every choice comes with its challenges; be aware of what you commit to.
transliteration: Marry a goat, and you'll see its horns.

text: Elonga epai nioso moko.
meaning: Emphasizes the importance of parental wisdom and guidance.
transliteration: Ne fais confiance qu’à ton père.

text: Dzafura churu chimwe dzava nzivani.
meaning: Shared experiences unite people.
transliteration: Those that have grazed at one anthill have become acquaintances.

text: Noloshaada iyo qof walba waa ku jiraan.
meaning: Encourages collaboration and recognizing the interdependence of success.
transliteration: Your success is connected to others.

text: Xam sa bopp, moo gën ku la ko wax.
meaning: It is best to self assess situations before outsiders do it for you.
transliteration: It is better to know oneself before you are told who you are

text: Ujakalashe ukhalela ukudla kwenyani.
meaning: It warns against deception, suggesting that true intentions may not always be apparent.
transliteration: The jackal cries over the real food.

text: Adíyẹ ńjẹ yangan, ó ńmu omi ó ńgbé ókúta mì, ó tún ńsunkún àìléyín; ṣé òbúkọ tó léyín ńjẹ irin ni?
meaning: Be contented; shun greed
transliteration: Hens eat corns, drink water and swallow stones . Yet lament lacking teeth; do goats eat pieces of iron with theirs?

text: Thathaa tollaan ol fuudhun nama hindhibu
meaning: A good plan makes the work easier
transliteration: (If) tied well, (it) does not bother lifting up a man

text: Ɔnanka tiri yɛtwa no mmarima.
meaning: It takes real courage to do a dangerous job.
transliteration: Only a real man can cut off the head of a viper.

text: ኹሉ የሚገኝ ከእሱ፤ የሚገኝ የለም ያለ ርሱ፡
meaning: All things come from a single source, and nothing exists without it.
transliteration: Everything is available from Him; There is none without Him.

text: Ko henndu waddi duluuru ɓofti
meaning: One action is a starting point to be followed by another
transliteration: What wind brings is what hurricane carries

text: Lashe-lashe da taro shi ne biki.
meaning: Entertainment is the highlight of an occasion
transliteration: Licking is what defines an occasion

text: Onye obi ọkụ na-ebu onye ñụrụ iyi arụsị ụzọ were o̥nwụ
meaning: Misguided conduct at times brings about unnatural disaster
transliteration: A hot-tempered person often dies before the one who has taken fetish oath

text: Ukubambezeleka okude kwembula iqiniso.
meaning: Delays in actions or decisions often lead to revealing underlying motives or intentions, highlighting the importance of patience in understanding situations.
transliteration: A long delay reveals the truth.

text: Intimba yonkwa n'iyayo
meaning: You can't forget someone who treated you badly. It is used to tell someone who betrayed you that he or she can no longer be friends.
transliteration: Intimba yonkwa n'iyayo

text: Amwasie azizi muumba umwongoe.
meaning: A person who revolts stands in the need of prayer. It is a dangerous business to revolt against authority.
transliteration: Put the person who revolts against the loving Creator back on the right path.

text: Huwana moko ezali nzambe.
meaning: It emphasizes the inherent worth and dignity of every individual.
transliteration: Every person has value.

text: Zirume kutswinya mwana padama, kuti vari mumba vanzwe.
meaning: Sometimes a person provokes a weaker one in order to provoke his/her superior.
transliteration: A big man pinches a child on the cheek, so that those in the house can hear.

text: Ninkii gaadhi jiraa, ayuu galaba qabsan karaa.
meaning: Success allows for recognition and leadership.
transliteration: The one who has reached the top can grab the flag.

text: Boti mbuguel jela na gaka.
meaning: Love sees no fault.
transliteration: The eye of love sees beyond stains.

text: Ukuba khona abakulondolozele ukufa,.
meaning: If there are those who worry about dying, there must also be those who care about living It suggests that concern for death should be balanced with appreciation for life.
transliteration: If there are those who care about dying,.

text: Elékuru kì í kiri lóko
meaning: One wastes time attempting to sell things to those who produce them
transliteration: The seller of steamed ground beans does not hawk her wares on a farm

text: Maaf akka hamaa damma argatee qilthamta
meaning: A person should moderate excitement or joy
transliteration: Why (are you so excited) like honey seen by the honey-eater?

text: Anyemforɔ fata kwakuo.
meaning: Everyone has some period of beauty.
transliteration: Early pregnancy suits the monkey.

text: እኛ እኩል ተጠያቂዎች ነን ለሁለት እንከፍለው።
meaning: Acknowledging shared responsibility and the need for equitable solutions.
transliteration: We're equally to blame; should we divide it in half?

text: Sumpo to koyngal woni
meaning: Visit is a reflection of care for one another
transliteration: Relating well is on the leg

text: Ajiya mai wa rai dadi, tsohowa da ta aje mutuwa.
meaning: Storage gladdens the heart especially on the day you need it
transliteration: Storage makes the life sweet, an old woman storing death.

text: Agaghị m asị anya ọgọ m nwaanyị akpọlaa n'ihi na m agaghị eji isi ya were dozie ụlọ m.
meaning: If one neglects my advice and goes ahead with his plans, I have nothing to regret since I will not partake in any possible loss due to miscalculation.
transliteration: My mother-in-law can go ahead and become blind since ! am not going to decorate my house with her head.

text: Ayishunqi kungekho mlilo.
meaning: Actions reveal a person's character and legacy.
transliteration: Fire is revealed by its smoke

text: Amenyo arya inshuti ararumirwa
meaning: There are consequences when you disappoint a friend.
transliteration: The teeth that eat a friend are tasteless

text: Ni yule tu aliyekosa usingizi usiku anaweza kuelezea kilicho endelea.
meaning: It means that a person who went through a situation has experience about it and can advise, warn on it.
transliteration: Only the one who is sleepless in the night can tell what went on.

text: Akobanga nkisi te, akufi te
meaning: Recognizing someone's innocence and survival.
transliteration: Il n'a pas ensorcelé, il n'est pas mort.

text: Muto wetsenza ndiwo mumwe.
meaning: The apparent differences in beauty are an illusion.
transliteration: Soup from tuber roots is one and the same.

text: Dhegahayga gurmadu waxay kala geddisan yihiin.
meaning: It  metaphorically suggests keen perception or discernment, implying that one can easily distinguish between right and wrong or truth and falsehood.
transliteration: My eyes are capable of differentiating colors.

text: Lu waay rendi mu nàcc ci loxoom.
meaning: Whatever deed one does, they will bear the consequences good or bad.
transliteration: Whatever you slaughter, bleeds in your hands first.

text: Igadi yamathanga ifudumele.
meaning: Generosity and kindness create a nurturing environment for growth and prosperity.
transliteration: The pumpkin vine is warm.

text: Odò tó bá gbé igi ní ibú, kò ní fi ara ire ṣàn
meaning: Pursue the common good; the good of all is the good of one
transliteration: A river that carries a tree across its flow path will not flow easily

text: Agartudhaaf firooma waan yartutu ballessa
meaning: Take good care of friends
transliteration: The eye's pupil and friendship a small thing spoils

text: Anene anyɛ somakoroɔ amma Onyankopɔn nti na wakwan akwan no.
meaning: Disobedience to authority has negative repercussions.
transliteration: It is because the crow failed to fulfill the errand given to him by God that he laments aloud.

text: ለጥፍር ፍላጐት ጫማው ይጠፋል፣ ለጫማ ፍላጐት ፈረስ ይጠፋል፣ ለፈረስ ፍላጐት ጋላቢው ይጠፋል
meaning:
Small things can have huge implications. So, don’t
ignore nuances and minute details.
transliteration:
For want of a nail the shoe is lost, for want of a shoe the horse is lost, for want of a horse the 
rider is lost

text: Ko ɓernde yiɗi ɓanndu jaggantoo
meaning: We always strife to satisfy our desires
transliteration: What the heart wants the body suffers for

text: Baran mace ya sha ruwa, miji bai sha ba.
meaning: The proverb describes a situation of misplacement of priority where unworthy deserves the best to the detriment of the worthy personality.
transliteration: The servant of a woman had drunk water while her husband did not.

text: Ukpana na-ere n'ọkụ sị na ya na-asha mmanụ.
meaning: It's a sheer stupidity that made a rat to challenge a cat in a wrestling contest
transliteration: A grasshopper roasting over fire claims it is emitting fat.

text: Inja idla amathambo amadala.
meaning: People who are destitute.
transliteration: The dog is eating old bones.

text: Umugore gito ntimubura kubyarana
meaning: You learn to live with a bad person. It encourages people to endure their hardship and to learn to cope with them.
transliteration: You have babies with a bad wife anyway

text: Wasiokuwepo macho, huonekana moyoni.
meaning: Loved ones or valued individuals are remembered even when not physically present.
transliteration: Those who are absent in person are present in the heart.

text: Moto nyonso oyo alobi ete mayele ezali moto asengeli konyokwama na mbuma mabe na yango.
meaning: Take responsibility for your words. Assumer la responsabilité de ses paroles.
transliteration: He who says intelligence is a person should suffer the consequences. Celui qui dit que l'intelligence est une personne doit en subir les conséquences.

text: Nhasi chineni, mangwana chinewe.
meaning: Everybody can meet with challenges.
transliteration: Today it is with me, tomorrow it is with you.

text: Adiga iyo ashaadii, kuwo la kala qaybsanaa.
meaning: Advises fair distribution of opportunities.
transliteration: You and your luck should be equally shared.

text: Xaar ba jaan dem nga topp ca watit way dóor
meaning: It's too late to shut the stable door after the horse has bolted.
transliteration: Waiting until the snake has left then striking the tracks it left.

text: Ukuhamba kungabonakali kwabaphambili.
meaning: Progress or success is visible to those who have made advancements or achievements.
transliteration: Walking is the visibility of those who are ahead.

text: Bí ẹkẹ́-ẹ tálákà ò tó lówùúrọ̀, á tó lálẹ́.
meaning: The things one rejects when the choice is abundant will become acceptable when there is no choice.
transliteration: If a poor person's forked stake is not long enough in the morning, it will be long enough at night.

text: Namni dhadhaa afaan kaa'ani dagaa afaan nama kaa'a
meaning: To betray a benefactor
transliteration: When they place butter on his mouth, he puts stones in their mouth in return.

text: Worenyini a na wonhunu; na woyɛ bɔne deɛ a wohunu.
meaning: You cannot plead ignorance of an intentional offense.
transliteration: When you are growing old, you don’t notice it, but when you do bad things, you do notice it.

text: ዛፍ የፈለገ ቢረዝም ቅጠሉ መሬት ነው ሚወድቀው
meaning: Success is best balanced with humility and staying grounded.
transliteration: As tall as a tree may stand, its leaves will touch the ground

text: Henndu moore, ndiyam sanca
meaning: To do the opposite
transliteration: Wind to plait you, water to loosen it

text: Matar na tuba, ba ta rasa mijin aure.
meaning: Apologizing takes away wrath
transliteration: A woman who apologizes doesn't go without a husband.

text: Ọtụrụkpọkpọ na-akwado ihe ọ ga-eji ọnụ mee ụbọchị ọ ga-akwa nne ya, o ruo ụbọchị ahụ, etuto too ya n'ọnụ
meaning: When you have prepared what to do, the unexpected will happen
transliteration: A weaver bird was preparing what he will use his mouth to do on the day he will be celebrating his mother, when the day came, he became sick in his mouth

text: Izivakashi azibhali emnyango.
meaning: A warning against overstaying one's welcome.
transliteration: Guests do not write on the door.

text: Ubyawe na gito aba icyomanzi
transliteration: He/she who was born from small become a trickster.

text: Mwenye kijongo halali tani.
meaning: A poor person can never stop working and never rest.
transliteration: A hunchback cannot lie down on the back.

text: Mokolo oyo ezali koya eleki lelo na kitoko.
meaning: The road shouldn't curve; it should lead to my house.
transliteration: Le jour qui vient est meilleur qu'aujourd'hui.

text: Manga chena inoparira parere nhema.
meaning: The revelation of one thing could give away other concealed related things.
transliteration: A white pumpkin gives away where the dark one lies.

text: Calool la siman yahay waa cagaar.
meaning: Small issues can lead to significant consequences.
transliteration: A small fire can burn a big forest.

text: Meew mu wayul tuuru na.
meaning: A young person has died.
transliteration: Milk which hasn't curdled has spilt.

text: Ukuba kukhanya kukaMqhele, kufanele kuxotshwe.
meaning: Even familiar sources of comfort or guidance may need to be relinquished or overcome to address anxieties or challenges.
transliteration: If it's the light of the moon, it must be extinguished.

text: Kí eégún tó dé lAlágbaà-á ti ńfọ̀lẹ̀lẹ̀ jẹ̀kọ.
meaning: One got on very well before the other person happened on the scene.
transliteration: Long before the arrival of masqueraders the Alagbaa had been eating corn meal with steamed been loaves.

text: hiriyyaa tokkoof gaariin diina waliin wal lola.
meaning: Treat friends well and stand against adversaries
transliteration: Good to a friend; Fights against enemies.

text: Onipa bewu na sika tease
meaning: A reminder of the importance of managing one's resources wisely and considering how one's wealth might be used after they've passed on.
transliteration: Money outlives humans.

text: የረጋ ወተት ቅቤ ይወጣዋል
meaning: Something good can come out of a bad situation.
transliteration: Butter comes out of sour milk.

text: Nastii hoccaayi hisnataa gujjo
meaning: If one is known for something bad, he is always a suspect
transliteration: To say I just entered without picking anything does not exonerate a thief

text: In ka ji saki-saki ba a kamu ba
meaning: If it is serious, words will be inadequate
transliteration: If you hear let go, it means you have not been properly gripped

text: E kele onye akịdị ya gwọta ọzọ
meaning: Appreciate people for doing good and they will remain good
transliteration: When you greet someone, he will do more

text: Umuntu utusa labo abafanelekile.
meaning: Acknowledging someone's achievements or qualities is important, but it should be genuine and directed at deserving individuals.
transliteration: One praises those to whom praise is due.

text: Agahinda ni ukubura uwo ukunda
meaning: A lack of love or interpersonal relationships is a loss above all. it is used in situation where someone lost an important person in his/her life.
transliteration: Sorrow is to not have someone to love.

text: Dunia mwendo wa ngisi, kamwe msililiwale.
meaning:
The octopus goes backwards.
The ways of the world are completely unpredictable. But one day it may catch you in its grip.
transliteration: The world goes like an octopus, never forget that.

text: Moto oyo azali kobeta mai malamu akozinda na mai te
meaning: It emphasizes the importance of mastering skills to avoid failure.
transliteration: A person who swims well does not drown

text: Chave chigondora chave chimombe, kutadza kutunga hurema hwacho.
meaning: Take responsibility for action.
transliteration: When a calf has been weaned it has grown up, not being able to fight is its own disability

text: Hilaac bay kala noqonayaan.
meaning: The importance of being cautious for a peaceful existence.
transliteration: Caution brings harmony.

text: Bul di njëkkee li mujjee.
meaning: Don't put the cart before the horse.
transliteration: Don't start with what should be last.

text: Umnini uphila imizuzu.
meaning: Leaders or authorities are subject to the passage of time and the limitations of mortality, potentially reminding individuals of the transient nature of power or influence.
transliteration: The master lives in minutes.

text: Ẹni tó bímọ ọ̀ràn, ló ńpọ̀n-ọ́n
meaning: We bear the consequences of our actions
transliteration: Whoever gives birth to a troublesome child would be the one to back him

text: Shamane jarjartu qallaa citchitatu gadi qaba
meaning: A recurring problem teaches patience to a person.
transliteration: The weaver, rushing, is hindered by fragile threads that easily break.

text: Ɛkyɛm wɔ wo na sɛ wo de bɛhwe wo ho mperɛ aduasa a, yɛnkame wo
meaning: You can do what you like with your own property.
transliteration: If you have a shield and you want to strike yourself 30 times with it, no one will stop you.

text: ለሌለው ምን ትለው፡
meaning: How do you address or assist someone who lacks what they need?
transliteration: What do you say to the one who doesn't have it?

text: Mboowaanga ɓurii mboftinteenga
meaning: The person who is familiar with a thing is easy to deal with than someone to be trained
transliteration: A habitual one is better than one to be trained

text: Angulu mai zanzama, zuba idonki ya fi sata ciwo.
meaning: People often become suspicious of very patient people and those who are prudent about them constantly. Sometime people (especially guilty ones ) are scared of reserved ones lest they become vigilant in their affairs.
transliteration: Vulture who sits a lot, your glare is more painful than that of theft.

text: Nwata a mụrụ mụọ ọrịa bụ ọnwụ ka ọ na-eche
meaning: Whoever that faces destructions does not ask questions
transliteration: A child that was born with sickness is waiting for death

text: Ubumpofu bungowomuntu owenza isono.
meaning: Sin leads to poverty.
transliteration: Poverty is for the one who commits sin.

text: Amasaka aratundwa ubwonko ntibutundwa
meaning: It is hard to repair a damaged life
transliteration: Sorghum is collected, but the brain is not

text: Mtu akitaka tenda, lake huchimbia shimo.
meaning: If you have a plan or goal, you should work towards it quietly and not disclose your intentions because others might interfere.
transliteration: A person wanting to act digs a pit for his plan.

text: Nzela ya moto oyo azali ye moko ezali molai
meaning: Unexpected pain and kindness.
transliteration: Le chemin de la personne solitaire est long.

text: Rukova rwizi, kuyambuka unokwinya nguo.
meaning: A humble disposition is required to overcome difficulties.
transliteration: A brook is a river, when crossing you tuck up clothes.

text: Qof walba wuxuu ku dhacaa adhi.
meaning: Everyone has their own challenges.
transliteration: Everyone experiences their own hardships.

text: Li gën a jafe ci àddina mooy am alal ju ne gàññ, lew domm
meaning: Earning significant wealth through entirely honest means is an exceptionally difficult achievement, promoting the values of hard work and honesty.
transliteration: The hardest thing in the world is to have great wealth legitimately .

text: Umbala ka-inki mawufane nomhlophe, kodwa umnquma lowo nomhlophe.
meaning: Effective leadership values contributions from individuals regardless of their background or appearance.
transliteration: The color of ink may differ from white, but its effect is the same.

text: Ẹgbẹ̀rún òkè, kò lè dá katapílà dúró
meaning: Don’t try anything out of your capacity, avoid disgrace
transliteration: Thousands of hills cannot stop a caterpillar tractor

text: du'aan hin qabu mormmaa.
meaning: The deceased cannot advocate or influence outcomes on their behalf.
transliteration: There is no advocate for the dead.

text: Sekan kuri Aboagye; ‘"M’anim anyɛ nnam a, ɛte sɛ odwannini mmɛn.
meaning: A powerful person may lose some of their power, but their remaining power still gives them the capacity to cause some things.
transliteration: Take me, Aboagye, as a blunt machete. If my blade is not sharp, it is as sharp as the horns of a ram.’’

text: የደንቆሮ ለቅሶ መልሶ መልሶ
meaning: A persistent and loud cry suggests ongoing distress or frustration.
transliteration: A deafening cry, again and again.

text: Darataako dow lisal e feƴƴa-ngal
meaning: It means you are facing danger foolishly
transliteration: You don’t stand of a tree branch and cut it

text: Mutum daya, ba ya daukar daki.
meaning: A shared burden is easier to carry
transliteration: One person cannot carry a room.

text: Ọlụ bịara mmadụ ka ọ bụ okorobịa bịara ya n'oge ọma
meaning: Youthful time is very productive
transliteration: A task that comes at one's youthful age come at a good time

text: Izithunywa zikaMthwakazi ningalahli ithemba.
meaning: True love perseveres through challenges.
transliteration: Mthwakazi's messengers, do not despair

text: Insinzi y'igikenya iboneka cyapfuye
meaning: Unworthy battles will kill you
transliteration: The victory of a notorious person is found when they are dead

text: La moyo wa mnyonge, ushamba wake huonekana.
meaning: Simple and honest intentions are apparent in vulnerable individuals.
transliteration: The heart of the weak, their simplicity is evident.

text: Bato batindeli esika ya ndenge na ngonga.
meaning: Truth reveals itself in the end.
transliteration: Les gens attendent la fin pour voir qui a raison.

text: Apinda murutsva anosviba tsoka,
meaning: Once you have given yourself to an arduous task, you must not be deterred by an inconvenience. A person must take responsibility of their actions.
transliteration: One who passes through burnt veld will get dirty feet.

text: Xanuunka biyaha ma haysano, waanu ka biya haynaa.
meaning: Acknowledging human responsibility for pollution and environmental issues.
transliteration: Water doesn't ask for sickness; we bring sickness to water.

text: Xalele bañ na loo mu tàmm.
meaning: Satisfying a child's every desire can make them unappreciative.
transliteration: The child hates him who gives it all it wants.

text: Inqakuleko ngonyaka, iyaphela emini.
meaning: Temporary joys or successes are fleeting.
transliteration: The happiness of a year ends in the day.

text: Aṣèbà ńwá ẹni rere kúnra.
meaning: Evil people always seek the company of good people to burnish their image.
transliteration: The evildoer seeks good people to associate with.

text: "Tiyya buute" jette tan masaanuun duute.
meaning: the proverb  underscores the idea that the absence of opposition can bring a sense of liberation or freedom.
transliteration: "Mine has dropped" said a woman whose opponent is dead.

text: Mogya mpa huruiiɛ tirim da.
meaning: An evil person is never without evil thoughts.
transliteration: There is always blood in the head of a tsetse fly.

text: ከሌሉ ስለእርስዎ እናወራለን።
meaning: Be mindful of your actions and reputation, as people will talk about you when you're not around.
transliteration: We will gossip about you if you’re absent.

text: Ko welnanaa fuu no welay
meaning: The success of what you do depends on dedication on it
transliteration: Whatever is sweetened will certainly be sweet

text: Ba a yin nutso a tsandauri.
meaning: You cannot get anything from a stingy person
transliteration: You cannot immerse into a hard ground.

text: Nwata a na-etịrị ụsụrụgada ya na-agba, amaghị na ụsụrụgada bụ egwu mmụọ
meaning: Ignorance can lead people to early grave
transliteration: A child that dances careless, does not know that careless dance is the dance of the spirit

text: Lapho iphakethe lamabele lifika, liyabalwa.
meaning: It underscores the importance of accountability and responsible stewardship in managing communal assets.
transliteration: When the pack of sorghum arrives, it is counted.

text: Iby'abacuzi mbihariye abakannyi
meaning: Everyone should do what they are specialized to do. It puts emphasis on professionalism and specialty.
transliteration: What is for forging belongs to blacksmith

text: Awali kuwa aheri si ajabu.
meaning: This proverb suggests that when a situation or endeavor starts off well or on a positive note, it is more likely to lead to a successful outcome. It emphasizes the importance of a strong and positive start in achieving favorable results.
transliteration: It's not surprising for a good beginning to end well.

text: Bapesaka mwana moko na moto.
meaning: Acceptance of responsibilities. Acceptation des responsabilités.
transliteration: A child is given to a person. Un enfant est donné à une personne.

text: Manakira kure mvura yemubvumbi.
meaning: Something that appears effective, and wonderful from afar may in fact be the opposite on closer inspection.
transliteration: Appearing good from a distance like persistent showery rainfall.

text: Ninkii heystaa garab, gacmahana ka raaco.
meaning: Encourages self-respect and dignity in actions.
transliteration: One who has shame can also lift his hand.

text: Dee du jaas.
meaning: Death is inevitable.
transliteration: Death does not miss.

text: Isiqhamo sikaJongilizwe asivumi ukushaywa.
meaning: Those in positions of power or protection often prevent themselves from being harmed or attacked.
transliteration: Jongilizwe's shield does not allow spearing.

text: Òkété pẹ̀lú ọmọ ẹ̀ di ọgbọọgba sínú ihò; nígbà tí ìyá ńfehín pàkùrọ́, ọmọ náà ńfehín paá pẹ̀lú
meaning: Too much familiarity makes comrades of people who are quite distant from each other in standing
transliteration: The giant bush rat and its child become equals in their hole; the mother cracks palm nuts with her teeth, and the child does the same thing

text: Mataa isaa aaddatee
meaning: Making a significant change can offer a sense of renewal or freedom.
transliteration: He shaved his head.

text: Sekantia gye ne ho abɔfra nsam.
meaning: Dangerous things can cause lots of harm except they are handled by careful people.
transliteration: A short knife frees itself from a child’s hand.

text: የላይኛው ከንፈር ለክርክር የታችኛው ከንፈር ለምስክር
meaning: This proverb implies that the upper lip is used for engaging in arguments or debates, while the lower lip is used for giving testimony or speaking honestly
transliteration: Upper lip for argument, lower lip for testimony

text: Kodde nanii lamɗam
meaning: The right thing has happened
transliteration: The course flour has got some salt

text: Ba kullum safiya, takan yi Aljumma ba.
meaning: Somedays are bad days
transliteration: Not every morning makes a Friday

text: Onye a na-akpụrụ ụtara ga na-ewelite ọnụ ya
meaning: You are supposed to work hard when people are helping you
transliteration: The person that is being fed should be the one that will draw his mouth closer

text: Lola umkhonto, kungenzeka ubuthuntu.
meaning: Continually improve skills and tools to maintain effectiveness.
transliteration: Sharpen a spear, it may be blunted.

text: Utaganiriye na se ntamenya icyo sekuru yavuze
meaning: It is good to discuss with knowledgeable people to get insights on different topics.
transliteration: The one who doesn't discuss with their father does not know what their grandfather said before dying.

text: Dhahabu haitoi shingo.
meaning: Wealth does not necessarily bring happiness or solve all problems.
transliteration: Gold does not stretch the neck.

text: Vuta miso, miso ekoya.
meaning: Actions have consequences.
transliteration: Payez avec vos yeux, vos yeux reviendront.

text: Muroi munhu, kubayiwa anochema.
meaning: No person is invulnerable.
transliteration: A witch is a human being, when stabbed they cry.

text: Milicsi kuma qarin karto.
meaning: Certain qualities or behaviors are inherent and cannot be changed.
transliteration: A hyena cannot comb its hair.

text: Tere, tere, mu të, bàyyil mu gis.
meaning: If someone refuses to listen to advice, allow them to see the consequences.
transliteration: Forbid, forbid, they refuse to listen, leave them to see.

text: Ukuba nengqondo, ngenxa yobusi.
meaning: Intelligence or wisdom stems from one's own intellect or effort.
transliteration: If you're wise, it's because of your brains.

text: Èṣù ò níwà, a kọ́lé-e rẹ̀ síta.
meaning: Esu lacks good character; therefore, his house is built outdoors.
transliteration: Esu lacks good character; therefore, his house is built outdoors.

text: Nama ariifatanii jajan, booda tuffachuun nama dhiba.
meaning: the proverb highlights the importance of patience and thorough observation in forming lasting opinions about others, implying that quick praise or disdain can lead to later regret or inconsistency.
transliteration: It is difficult to praise someone in a hurry and despise them later.

text: ወንድ ልጅ ታዛዥ ቢመስልም, ላይሆን ይችላል; ልጆች ማታለል ይችላሉ.
meaning: Children may appear obedient on the surface but may behave differently when not supervised.
transliteration: Even if a boy seems obedient, he might not be; children can be deceiving.

text: Hunnduko taƴata daande
meaning: The action of one’s mouth can land a person into big trouble
transliteration: The mouth cuts the throat

text: Wanda ya riga ka barci zai riga ka tashi
meaning: He who starts a thing before you is most likely to finish before you and has a better knowledge of it than you
transliteration: He who sleeps before you, will wake before you

text: Pam pam ka nkwụ ji eju ọgba
meaning: Little by little you can achieve big things
transliteration: It is gradually that makes a palm tree to cover a cave

text: Owesifazane akazisengi izinkomo.
meaning: Traditionally, women weren't responsible for milking cows, so this proverb highlights roles within society and implies specialization.
transliteration: A woman doesn't milk the cows.

text: Umuntu asinda akariho
meaning: People live the reality of everyday experiences
transliteration: A person becomes drunk for what exists

text: Athari ya kidole hasara ya mwili.
meaning: If one member of the household is bad or sick, the whole house will suffer.
transliteration: A sore finger hurts the whole body.

text: Akoma na moto, akende kozanga mokili.
meaning: A passionate or courageous person can make a difference in the world.
transliteration: The heart of fire travels around the world.

text: Hari haiviri pasina mukuchidziri.
meaning: Everything that is worthwhile will need constant attention.
transliteration: The pot will not boil without someone attending to the fire

text: Qoorta la siman yahay, laakiinna ku hayo la isu kala qaado.
meaning: Stresses the fragility of reputation and honor.
transliteration: Honor is difficult to maintain, but it is easy to lose.

text: Lu wangha di dohh norr.
meaning: It is quite unusual to see you.
transliteration: What is a wet season worm doing in the dry season.

text: Amaphupha azokunceda.
meaning: It encourages paying attention to dreams for guidance.
transliteration: Dreams will help you.

text: Ká lówó rẹpẹtẹ, kò dà bí kó yẹ̀ èyàn
meaning: When you see danger, run away from it!
transliteration: Stay away from hazards like a living snake

text: Jaarsoliin durii ulee qabatanii deeman; warri bara keenyaa ka'anii nyaatu.
meaning:
An honoured person, even if he is poor, even if he cannot find a place to sit, squats on his heels, 
but does not taste a morsel nor drink a drop, standing up.
transliteration: The old men of the past carried a stick; those of our days eat standing up.

text: Mmɔbɔnsɛ nyɛ nam bi nanso ɛtere nkwan.
meaning: No one is without their use in society.
transliteration: Shrimps are not meat but they add flavor to soup.

text: አንድ ሰው ለአንድ ሰው ማገልገል እንደማይችል ሁሉ አሁን ሁለት ሰው ለሁለት ሰው ማገልገል አይችልም።
meaning: Cooperation and division of labor make tasks more manageable and efficient.
transliteration: Just as one person can't serve one person, now two people can't serve two people.

text: Ido ba kan son bako ba.
meaning: There is comfort in habitual activities, i.e change is scary
transliteration: The eyes doesn't like a visitor.

text: Aka nri kwọọ aka ekpe, aka ekpe akwọ aka nri
meaning: There is accrue benefit in mutuality
transliteration: If the right hand scrubs the left, the left hand will in turn scrub the right

text: Amaphupho awanabo ububi.
meaning: Dreams are neutral; it's our interpretation that may make them good or bad.
transliteration: Dreams have no evil

text: Umugore gito arutwa n'umwanzi gica
meaning: Having a loved who hates you is dangerous than being hated openly by someone from outside your circle.
transliteration: A bad wife is worse than a very open enemy.

text: Panapo mvinyo, pana kelele na vurugu.
meaning: It is honorable for a man to stop striving since any fool can start a quarrel.
transliteration: Where there is wine, there is also noise and tumoil.

text: Eteni ya liboso eyaka, eteni ya mibale eyaka mpe
meaning: You can rely on God as if he were your family.
transliteration: The first term comes, the second term comes too.

text: Hukwana inodya ndeiri pana mai.
meaning: People closest to the source of help are most likely to benefit.
transliteration: The chick that feeds is one that is where the mother is.

text: Nabadu waa daacad, ninka waa kiciya.
meaning: Peace itself is inherently good and just; it's people's actions that can disrupt it.
transliteration: Peace is upright; it's the individual who veers off.

text: Su tan gore woon, bu ñuy gubal mbaam, mu ëpp caw say.
meaning: One should be straightforward and sincere in their actions
transliteration: If the vulture was grateful, it would contribute more in the feeding of the donkey

text: Isimnyama sesinophansi, sithole izilonda.
meaning: Wrongdoers or hidden faults eventually face consequences.
transliteration: The darkness from below receives wounds.

text: Bí ọmọdé bá ńṣe ọmọdé; àgbà a máa ṣe àgbà
meaning: One should not permit other people's misbehaviour to deflect one from the proper course
transliteration: When a child is being a chld, an elder must remain an elder

text: Nama waliin oltuu natti himi eenyuu akka taate sittanima
meaning: The company you keep reflects your character.
transliteration: Tell me who you are dating and I will tell you who you are.

text: Onyina se, sɛ ne so nni mfasoɔ a, na ɛnyɛ ne porɔ mu a.
meaning: Everything has some usefulness in one way or time.
transliteration: The silk-cotton says that if it is of no use, it is not so when it gets rotten.

text: ሀብታም ሊሰጥ ደሀ ምርጥ ያወጣል
meaning: Empowerment and agency among those facing economic hardship, even in the face of generosity from others.
transliteration: The rich will give, and the poor will choose the best.

text: Nyaaki piɗii metoowo to ɗemngal
meaning: It is like an end to a nuisance
transliteration: Bees have bitten the talkative in his tongue

text: Dan kaza, in ka samu ki dangi.
meaning: Wealth makes you live an individualistic life
transliteration: When a chicken gets, he forgets family.

text: Ohu hụrụ otu e si eli enyi ya, ga ama ka a ga esi eli ya onwe ya.
meaning: The evil that one does follows one.
transliteration: A servant who beholds the funeral of a fellow servant expects a similar funeral for himself.

text: Ingane yesikhukhukazi ilandela lapho kuphekwa khona.
meaning: Children often mimic their parents' behavior.
transliteration: A child of a hen follows to the cooking place.

text: Agakurikiwe n’abagabo ntikabasiga
meaning: Unity creates strength. You can achieve your goals when working together with like-minded people
transliteration: What is followed by men will never escape

text: Ziwa lisilo na visima, hupukutika maji.
meaning: Sustenance and depth come from continuous sources.
transliteration: A lake without springs becomes shallow.

text: Ezali lokola kobuka nzete
meaning: Lack of insight leads to misjudgment.
transliteration: It's like plucking with a stick.

text: Chakafukidza dzimba matenga.
meaning: What is news on the outside does not depict the interior.
transliteration: What covers the houses are roofs.

text: Ninka waa lacag, hadduu la aamiyo wuxuu gaadho.
meaning: Highlights the value of a person's reputation.
transliteration: A man is like money; if known, he brings benefit.

text: Ku aju du sain sa kow.
meaning: Being at the top limits your outlook.
transliteration: The one above cannot see the top.

text: Ukuba kwaba nzima, kwabangathi kube khona.
meaning: It implies that enduring hardships or challenges can create the illusion of a refuge or sanctuary.
transliteration: If it was tough, it seemed like there was a place.

text: Ó sú mi, ó rẹ̀ mí, kì í ṣe ọdẹ erin
meaning: The bigger the dream,the more the persistence required
transliteration: "I'm tired and fed up" can't be coming from someone hunting an elephant

text: Nyaanni guddaan udaan guddisa
meaning: Over-eating is useless and wastefull.
transliteration: Eating a big meal leads to big bowel movements.

text: Onipa anim nyɛ burodua na ɔde agye ahohora/animguaseɛ
meaning: You should maintain self-respect as once it is lost, it is difficult to regain.
transliteration: A person's face is not like the cob of corn, which could be used to clean off one's shame/disgrace.

text: አሞራ በዛፍ ውርርድ በጫፍ
meaning: Strategic positioning for advantage.
transliteration: A vulture in a tree is like a bet in a tip.

text: Jahilci rigar kaya.
meaning: Illiteracy is a disease
transliteration: Illiteracy is a thorny apparel.

text: Ọji ruo ụlọ okwuo ebe osi bịa.
meaning: People are known by they have achieved
transliteration: When the kola reaches home, it will tell where it was coming from.

text: Izinganekwane zolwandle ziqala osebeni lomfula.
meaning: Great things often have humble beginnings, and significant events can have origins in seemingly inconsequential places.
transliteration: The tales of the sea start from the riverbanks.

text: Ineza yiturwa indi
meaning: A good deed deserves another good deed. It is used when someone does something good to someone who has helped them. It is also used to encourage people to do good.
transliteration: Kindness is returned by kindness

text: Umande hauogopi shemeji.
meaning: A determined person overcomes difficulties.
transliteration: The in-law is not afraid of the morning dew.

text: Buatu ekoki kobaluka kasi makambo ekanama ekotikala seko.
meaning: The unpredictability of life is at the mercy of the currents, but the ultimate destination or outcome remains constant.
transliteration: The boat may drift, but fate remains.

text: Karipako ikonje inofunda chirimo.
meaning: If a person is in familiar territory, they are likely to come up with solutions to challenges they may come across.
transliteration: What is at its own place is sisal which produces new shoots in winter.

text: Ninkii daalimi lahaa, markuu iska dhiibo, mar dambe, waa la cabirayaa.
meaning: Individuals known for their honesty or integrity may face scrutiny or suspicion when they assume positions of authority.
transliteration: The one who had integrity, when he takes charge, eventually, he is questioned.

text: Wàcc, daanoo ci gën a gaaw.
meaning: Be Direct.
transliteration: Falling is the easiest way to climb down.

text: Ukulungiselela okuphambene ngokubona.
meaning: Being prepared for challenges allows for better navigation through difficult situations.
transliteration: Prepare for the worst by seeing it coming.

text: Èèmọ̀ ju èèmọ̀ lọ, babaláwo tó kú silé aláìsàn
meaning: What an irony of life, the person who went to heal a patient die in his house, it’s a mystery
transliteration: What a grievous situation, the doctor dies in the house of patient!

text: Ulfofte foonif bonyaan, dorroba qalani nyaachisan deese annanif bonyaan wanti eelman obaassan dhibe
meaning: A person cannot have the cake and also eat it
transliteration: While pregnant she wept for meat, they killed a cow and fed her; after giving birth she wept for milk but gave trouble something to milk for drinking.

text: Nipabɔne dwane kwaapono mu.
meaning: The path of a bad person is always crooked.
transliteration: A wicked person takes the crooked path.

text: የልጁ እድገት በእናቱ ላይ ብቻ የተመካ አይደለም.
meaning: Childrearing is a collective responsibility.
transliteration: A child's growth does not solely depend on its mother.

text: Mo haaraayi harnataa
meaning: You can only give what you have
transliteration: The person who is not satisfied cannot make another replete

text: Da rarrafe akan tashi
meaning: There are different stages in life
transliteration: After crawling, comes standing

text: Ọ bụ onye nna ya tụgburu na-atụgbute.
meaning: Family virtues imparted on children guide them in future life.
transliteration: The son of a marksman may not also be his own missing target.

text: Uzowukhomba umuzi onotshwala.
meaning: This is when you are threatening a person who is causing trouble.
transliteration: You will point out the house that has alcohol.

text: Ingoma nto yica nk'inini
meaning: What a leader in a very powerful position faces is not different what a another from a small position does.
transliteration: A big kingdom kills people like a big one would.

text: Mzigo mwenda pole ni mzito.
meaning: Procrastination or delays can make a task more difficult.
transliteration: A slow-moving load is heavy.

text: oyo ebungaki, ebunga lokola elili.
meaning: Loss is irreversible; it disappears like a shadow.
transliteration: What has been lost, is lost like a shadow.

text: Chigare chenda, kudya akaitakura.
meaning: Sometimes people seem ungrateful for kindness received, or even harm those they depend on.
transliteration: It is louse's disloyalty, to feed on the one that carries it.

text: Hooyadii waa laga xumaaday, qoyskii ma xumayso.
meaning: Individual mistakes should not reflect on the whole family.
transliteration: The mother may be disgraced, but the family is not disgraced.

text: Mbota gena buga ndohh wanteh bu tanga boku cha.
meaning: No matter how good you are you have your limitations.
transliteration: Frogs love water but not hot water.

text: Umntu nomyeni bakhe bamnika amazinyo.
meaning: People in close relationships support and complement each other.
transliteration: A person and their spouse give each other teeth.

text: Adìẹ ò lè ti ìwòyí sunkún ehín
meaning: Everything at its proper time
transliteration: A chicken cannot at this late date bemoan its lack of teeth

text: Sagalen Waaqayyo akka dhagaa daakuti
meaning: The Lord crushes and refines the spirit of his people
transliteration: The word of God is like a grinding stone.

text: Mmusuo ankɔ a, siadeɛ mma.
meaning: You cannot be lucky and unlucky at the same time.
transliteration: If calamity does not give way, fortune does not come.

text: ለመታማት መፍራት
meaning: This phrase likely means feeling anxious or worried about being the subject of gossip or rumors.
transliteration: Afraid to get gossiped

text: Raa mukka ɓurii raa wakka
meaning: It is better to be served food than to carry it
transliteration: See put inside mouth, better see strap

text: Iya yi, karuwa da yawon dare.
meaning: Going overboard
transliteration: Overdo, a prostitute walking at night.

text: Ego bụ mma nkọ
meaning: With money, you can get anything you want
transliteration: Money is the sharpness of a knife

text: Ukukhathazeka kwenhliziyo kuholela ekuqondeni.
meaning: Reflecting on one's worries leads to understanding.
transliteration: The anxiety of the heart leads to understanding.

text: Urwariye abandi ntirukwibagirwa
meaning: It used to warn someone that what happened to others could happened to the as well.
transliteration: What (death) ate others, didn't  forget you.

text: Baa haipati mmoja.
meaning: If one person of the homestead is in trouble or has done bad things, all the others suffer too.
transliteration: Misfortune does not get [only] one.

text: Motema ya wolo
meaning: Praise for generosity. Louant la générosité.
transliteration: Heart of gold. Cœur d'or.

text: Nhonhongora kudya chayo, kukumbirirei uchi kudondi?
meaning: It is arrogance for a rich person to beg from a poor person.
transliteration: A big bee eating its own store, why ask for honey from a small one?

text: Iyo Ninkii Hawshu Hal Ma Jiifsado.
meaning: Emphasizes that hard work and effort lead to positive outcomes and rewards.
transliteration: And the one who works will not remain one-handed.

text: Am joo gis, indil mochey tegu.
meaning: Be financially independent.
transliteration: Every donation is followed by give it back.

text: Ukuba nenamhlanje akuqinisekisi ngengomso.
meaning: Effective leaders plan and prepare for the future, understanding that circumstances can change unpredictably.
transliteration: Having today doesn't guarantee tomorrow.

text: Ẹ̀là lọ̀rọ̀; bóbìnrín bá jókòó a laṣọ babẹ́.
meaning: One must always be clear in one's speeches or intentions.
transliteration: Statements must always be clarified; when a woman sits, she covers her genitals with her wrapper.

text: Abban dhiqa hinqabu
meaning: It implies that the father's role is respected and revered, and his actions are often viewed with admiration and approval.
transliteration: A father is never dirty.

text: Nenkyemɔnɔ amma yɛahunu ɔbaa bɔne.
meaning: A good helper hides his master’s weakness.
transliteration: Tomatoes have made it impossible to identify an incompetent woman.

text: ለራሱ የማይረባ ለሌላም አይረባ
meaning: Personal preferences or idiosyncrasies may seem strange or nonsensical to others, but they are valid to the individual.
transliteration: What is absurd to himself should not be absurd to anyone else.

text: Koyɗe bumɗo somataa fergaaki
meaning: You must live with a condition that you cannot change
transliteration: The feet of a blind person are never tired of stumbling

text: Ana yi da kai ya fi ba a yi da kai.
meaning: Better a little than nothing at all
transliteration: They are doing with you is better than they are not.

text: Otito nwa ogbịị na-abụ n'oge ọrụ.
meaning: Less significant people are often remembered only when they are to be used or exploited.
transliteration: An orphan receives recognition only when there is a job to be done.

text: umngane ungomunye phakathi kwabantu abaningi.
meaning: Friends are part of a wider community.
transliteration: A friend is one among many people.

text: Habunda uwirutse
meaning: Misery can follow you wherever you go.
transliteration: The one who running is the one that hides

text: Damu hutoa harufu.
meaning: People of the same clan never fail to know one another.
transliteration: Blood smells.

text: Bino etondi te, osalemi yo boye.
meaning: Seek advice when in doubt.
transliteration: Ce que tu ne sais pas, demande des directions.

text: Nhamo urimbo inonamira.
meaning: Poverty seems to target its victim and stick to them without any hope for them of breaking free.
transliteration: Poverty is like glue/gum it sticks.

text: Laakiin isla markaana, waa la mid tahay.
meaning: Acknowledging both sides of an argument or situation.
transliteration: But at the same time, it is also one.

text: Lu munuta nyaka fog mu am.
meaning: Some things are inevitable.
transliteration: Things that cannot  be missed will have to happen.

text: Inkunzi ehambayo iyanconywa.
meaning: Action or movement is often praised or recognized.
transliteration: A bull on the move is praised.

text: Ẹní bá ńjẹ òbúkọ tó gbójú, yó jẹ àgùtàn tó yọ̀wo.
meaning: A person known for daring deeds can always be expected to defy custom; one cannot cure people of ingrained habits.
transliteration: Whoever is used to eating full-grown he-goats will eat lambs that have sprouted horns.

text: kan shantamaa dhaluu shantamaa salphinni isaa.
meaning: Everyone has a unique destiny, no matter how similar their beginnings.
transliteration: Fifty births, fifty fates.

text: Mmirika mu wɔ biribi a, anka ɔkraman di hene.
meaning: Nothing good comes out of being overenthusiastic
transliteration: If there were something rewarding about running, a dog would be the king.

text: ፍራፍሬ ማድነቅ, ሥሮችን መርሳት
meaning: The tendency to admire success without fully appreciating the hard work and challenges that accompanied it.
transliteration: Admiring fruit, forgetting roots.

text: Da abinka ake kaunarka, in babu abinka kare ya fi ka.
meaning: People only love you when it's benefitial
transliteration: It's with your thing that you're loved, without it, a dog is better than you.

text: Ọ na-abụ a kpụrụ atụrụ were na-ama atụ, ihe a na-atụ atụ akarịa.
meaning: A person handling a serious task ought not indulge in senseless frivolities.
transliteration: When somebody is leading a sheep (atụrụ) and giving direction (atụ), it becomes an alliteration.

text: Amanxeba kaNtuzelelu alashwa yizinyoni.
meaning: This proverb praises the healing power of time and nature, suggesting that even the deepest wounds can be overcome with patience and care.
transliteration: The wounds of Ntuzelelu are healed by the birds

text: Amagambo menshi aziba amatwi
meaning: It's not a good idea to talk too much.  You don't need too much talking to be heard.
transliteration: Too much words close ears.

text: Ndio Mungu anaweza.
meaning: The Lord takes care of us as well as our work when we commit ourselves to him.
transliteration: Yes God can.

text: Moninga oyo atambolaka na yo akokamba yo.
meaning: Choose your friends wisely. Choisis tes amis avec sagesse.
transliteration: The friend who walks with you, will lead you. L'ami qui marche avec toi, te conduira.

text: Aive madziva ave mazambuko, aive mazambuko ave madziva.
meaning: Change of circumstances in reverse.
transliteration: What used to be deep pools are now bridges, while what used to be bridges are now deep pools.

text: Waxa cunaya iyo weligii la cuno waa kaamaqanahay.
meaning: Comparing one's actions or circumstances with others' is not productive.
transliteration: What you eat and what eats you are incomparable.

text: Ñaar a di yëf di jàmm ji àddina : ngor ak njullit. Ñaar di def jàmm ca àdduna : ngor ak njullit.
meaning: Our actions and deeds should be governed by honesty and a fear of God.
transliteration: Two things bring peace in the world: honourable behaviour and piety.

text: Ukulimala kwelanga kuyaxuka.
meaning: It implies that excess or overindulgence can lead to negative consequences.
transliteration: The fullness of the sun causes it to burn.

text: Ẹyẹ ńwú bà-ǹ-kù ba-n-ku, ìyẹ́ làṣírí ẹ̀.
meaning: A person's impressive appearance is not always backed by substance.
transliteration: The bird swells to a huge dimension, but the secret is in its feathers.

text: Sanyi haadha intala farso qal'oo
meaning: The offspring follows the characteristics of the parent
transliteration: Offspring of her mother, the daughter is beer thin

text: Nanteakasa hyia wuo a, na ɛfiri apetebie.
meaning: If you chase something continually, you court disaster.
transliteration: If the tree snake dies, it is because of the striped squirrel.

text: የማያውቁትን መስራት ከጥቅሙ ጉዳቱ ይብስ የማያውቁት ምን ያውቅ
meaning: If you're unfamiliar with something, you won't understand it.
transliteration: Doing what you don't know about the advantages and disadvantages of doing what you don't know

text: Mo geɗal menngo nanataa munyu
meaning: One destined to be slapped will not hear be patient
transliteration: One destined to be slapped will not hear be patient

text: Gaugawa ga dame, sai damu.
meaning: Impatience produces catastrophe
transliteration: Haste in mixing, creates a pulpy mass.

text: Ọ bụ naanị efurefu rere mma ya turu ọbọ ya.
meaning: It is a foolish man that throws away something that is very useful to his life without any good reason only to settle down for trifle.
transliteration: It is only a naughty man that sold his sword only to carry the empty sheat about.

text: Akukho lutho olungatholakala ngaphandle komhlaba.
meaning: Everything that exists can be found within the earth, there are no alien entities
transliteration: There is nothing that cannot be found outside the earth

text: Nta mutindi umwe
meaning: Under any circumstance, there are more than one person on earth who might be going through that.
transliteration: There is not only one poor person.

text: Mzaha unaleta ugomvi: ugomvi wapoteza maneno
meaning: If you are unsure whether a joke is appropriate, it is always best to err on the side of caution.
transliteration: Jesting brings forth quarrels; quarrels deprive control over words

text: Asaleli mokuse ya nzoto, akosalela moto.
meaning: Encouragement for individuals to discover and pursue their own unique paths and purposes in life.
transliteration: A tree's destiny is to remain a tree, and a person's destiny is to fulfill their purpose.

text: Rwavhi kufamba zvishoma, asi shungu runadzo.
meaning: One’s failure to retaliate when offended does not mean they have given in.
transliteration: A chameleon walks slowly, but it has the resolve.

text: Calaacal shidayso, koonfur wuxu kaa shaqaysan karaa.
meaning: Be prepared for the consequences of your actions, as external factors may exacerbate the situation.
transliteration: If you set a fire, the south wind will help you fan it.

text: Aawo buuru këram.
meaning: The first wife holds a position of authority and leadership in her polygamous household.
transliteration: The first wife is the ruler of her house.

text: Ukuphupha kwabulala kubutha.
meaning: Seeking revenge results in displaying one's actions or achievements proudly.
transliteration: The birth of the killer is a boast.

text: Odídẹrẹ́ ní wọn ò lè tí ojú òun yan òun mọ́ ẹbọ, bí wọ́n bá ńdÍfá, òun a sá wọlé.
meaning: The smart person should always distance himself or herself from disaster.
transliteration: The parrot says no one will prescibe it as a sacrifice in its presence; when it sees people consulting the oracle, it will go hide in its closet.

text: Jechaa afaanirra buu'ee hanqaaquun harakarra kufee tokko
meaning: Be careful what you say; words can't be unsaid.
transliteration: Word of mouth, cannot return.

text: Onipa anim nyɛ bonsua na y'ahohoro mu dabiara
meaning: A person should not wait to be scolded often before they do right.
transliteration: The human face is not an oil pot or cup which should be washed all the time.

text: ማንም ሰው ያለ ስጋት ወደ ጦርነት አይሄድም።
meaning: Any endeavor carries inherent risks.
transliteration: No one goes to war without risk.

text: Yiɗee ton nelee ton
meaning: For optimum results, people should be assigned tasks according to their expertise.
transliteration: He is liked there and is sent there

text: Kwabarsa ta yi ruwa
meaning: A day of imperfection or badluck
transliteration: A watery concoction

text: Onye chi ọjọọ rịaba ahụ, dibịa akọọ
meaning: Someone does not see a helper in the time of need
transliteration: If a person with bad luck falls sick, there will be scarcity of fortune-tellers

text: Inkomo idonswa ngoboya bayo obumhlophe bomsila.
meaning: Sometimes, the smallest detail can control a situation.
transliteration: A cow is pulled by its white tail hairs.

text: Ahakize hitwa inkovu
meaning: What happened is never forgotten. it is used to express the situation that can encourage you to do prohibited actions for survival.
transliteration: A scar is place which has healed.

text: Mkata arhamu siwo mwenye fahamu.
meaning: Emphasizes the importance of maintaining good relationships with family members and suggests that cutting ties with relatives is unwise.
transliteration: One who severs relations with relatives is not wise.

text: Vanda na yango ya bato, ozali yango ya bato.
meaning: Be careful of the company you keep.
transliteration: Stay with people's things, you become like them.

text: Kukonwa kwedare, kukonwa kwamambo.
meaning: In any situation, there is someone who must responsibility.
transliteration: Defeat of the chief's court is defeat of the chief.

text: Ninkii barbaarta geed la galay, geedna la galay.
meaning: Effort and resilience bring value beyond inherent qualities or attributes.
transliteration: He who climbed a tree is better than the tree itself.

text: Bëgg ju sañul feeñe, mook bañaale yem.
meaning: A desire which one cannot manifest is the same as rejection.
transliteration: A love which you lack audacity to show is the same as not loving.

text: Umlambo wamana waphuza indoda.
meaning: lack of boundaries can lead to harm.
transliteration: The river without banks drinks a person.

text: Àjàpá ní kò sí oun tó dà bí oun tí a mọ̀ ọ́ṣe; ó ní bí òun bá ju ẹyìn sẹ́nu, òun á tu èkùrọ́ sílẹ̀
meaning: Nothing succeeds like expertise
transliteration: Tortoise says there is nothing quite like expertise in one's calling; it says if it puts a palm fruit into its mouth, it spits out a palmnut

text: Harkii offii offiikaaye hinququ.
meaning: "Self-care silences complaints."
transliteration: "The hand that tends its own wound knows no complaint."

text: Nnipa baanu nti na yɛgye amanedeɛ.
meaning: Goodness satisfies different people.
transliteration: It is because of two people that a third person receives a parcel.

text: አረጉን ሲስቡት ዛፍ ይወዛወዛል
meaning: Actions have consequences.
transliteration: When you pull the rope, the tree sways.

text: Cincirindon banza taron caca.
meaning: A gathering of base fellows is worthless
transliteration: A useless gathering, the gathering of gamblers.

text: E ji ntị a mapụrụ amapụ anụ ihe kama na ọ bụ atụ ka a na-agaghị ịfanye na ya
meaning: A defect on something does not completely render it useless
transliteration: A cut off robed ear could be used for listening but not for the insertion of toothpick

text: Indlu ithola omunye umnikazi.
meaning: Change is inevitable; possessions and circumstances can shift unexpectedly.
transliteration: A house gets another owner

text: Rusigariye abaseka
meaning: Death should not be laughed at.
transliteration: Death holds itself in readiness for the ones who laugh

text: Mbele ya kuvuta tumbako, yafaa kukohoa.
meaning: Before engaging in a new or potentially harmful activity, it's wise to anticipate and consider the potential negative consequences.
transliteration: Before you start smoking tobacco, you better cough first.

text: Oyo abetaki lokola ngando, oyo abotamaki sika, oyo azali gɔigɔi, mpe oyo azali makasi.
meaning: Highlights the diversity of human behavior; one is mischievous, one is naive, one lacks motivation, and the other is resilient.
transliteration: Celui-ci a joué au singe, celui-là vient de naître, celui-là est paresseux et celui-là est fort.

text: Munongedzo hauzvinongedzi.
meaning: People are blind to their faults.
transliteration: An index finger does not point at itself.

text: Ninkii kala go'daa dhib bay u dhacaysaa.
meaning: Unity is strength; division leads to problems.
transliteration: One who divides himself will face trouble.

text: Àddina ñett a ci gën : àjjana biti, ak weerteewlu ak mëneek say dëkk, ak ku la gis bëgg la
meaning: As long as you have good health, love your neighbours and treat everyone you meet kindly, that is a full life.
transliteration: Three are necessary in life; good health, being at peace with your neighbors and being loved by all.

text: Isipho sikankulunkulu sigcwele ikhaya.
meaning: Blessings or good fortune return to their origin.
transliteration: The gift from God returns home.

text: Rọra dì, ká lè bá ọ sá.
meaning: A person who wants other people's help must lighten his or her baggage.
transliteration: Pack judiciously that we may accompany you while you escape.

text: Gowwaan, ganama hin dhufu jedhee yaadee, mana keessatti fincaa'a.
meaning: This is used when someone mistreats someone else or harms himself, thinking that the situation will not change for the better.
transliteration: The fool, thinking that morning will not come, defecates at home.

text: Asɛm suro bɔdwesɛ ( ɔbarima katakyie).
meaning: Everyone succumbs to their superior.
transliteration: A case fears a beard (brave man).

text: ብቻዬን መሸከም አልችልም አንድ ላይ ግን ብርሃን ይሆናል።
meaning: Collaboration makes burdens easier to bear.
transliteration: I can't carry it alone; but together, it becomes light.

text: Haarannde kaaruɗo nafataa beelaaɗo
meaning: It is what is relevant to you that should worry you
transliteration: The replete of someone who has eaten has no effect on a hungry person

text: Na iya maganin na sani.
meaning: Practice in better than theory. It shows that what one is able to do outweighs what he/she simply hear of.
transliteration: I can is better than I know

text: E lelịa nwa ite, ọ gbọnyụo ọkụ
meaning: Don’t underrate the potential and ability of other people
transliteration: If look down on a small pot, it will quench the fire

text: Indlovu ayincane, inkonyane.
meaning: Some things are just inherently big or significant.
transliteration: An elephant is not small, it's a calf.

text: Akamenyero kayitaye mu mutego
meaning: When you get too comfortable you put yourself at risk.
transliteration: Habit threw it into the trap.

text: Uchwewapo na jua lala pale.
meaning: If you are taken by surprise by something you did not expect, do not despair.
transliteration: When surprised by the sunset, sleep right there.

text: Tokoki koyeba ntango nini mokakatano ezali.
meaning: Problems are often predictable. Les problèmes sont souvent prévisibles.
transliteration: We can know when there's a problem. Nous pouvons savoir quand il y a un problème.

text: Maoko anogezana.
meaning: People assist one another.
transliteration: Hands was each other.

text: Ninkii la daboole, dawo ayaan isku darsaday.
meaning: Adversity teaches valuable lessons and motivates one to seek solutions and improve their situation.
transliteration: The one who suffered learns to seek remedy.

text: Aduna amut solo.
meaning: Take an easy approach to life.
transliteration: The world is insignificant.

text: sidenge sikala lomgwaqo
meaning: It suggests that individuals who mock or belittle others may face their own downfall, highlighting the importance of humility and respect.
transliteration: The hyena laughs at the pack.

text: Ò ńbá obìnrin ẹ jà ò ńkanrí mọ́nú; o máa nà á lóògùn ni?
meaning: One should moderate one's response to annoyances.
transliteration: You quarrel with your wife and you put on a baleful look; do you propose to use an evil charm on her?

text: A jedhaa mindaa irra jira jedhi.
meaning: Similarly, saying "aaa" led to receiving their salary, indicating a positive result or reward, possibly for minimal effort or a simple action.
transliteration: When they said "aaa", they got paid their salary

text: Onipa ho nyɛ fɛ nkosi aseɛ.
meaning: No one can be perfect.
transliteration: A person can never be entirely beautiful.

text: ቀስ አንዳይደፈረስ
meaning: This proverb likely means that it's important to proceed cautiously or deliberately in situations where there is risk or danger.
transliteration: slow, don't dare (to be in a rush)

text: Duroowo colli ɓamtataa sawru
meaning: Those in glass houses should not through stones
transliteration: The person who tends birds does not raise stick

text: An ci gari da mu, mun kama kuturun bawa.
meaning: We conquered and made away with booty
transliteration: They ate the town with us and we caught a leprous slave.

text: Oke ọhịa kaa nka, ọ n̊ụba ara nwa ya
meaning: Old parents deserve the care of their children
transliteration: When a bush rat gets quite old, it will begin to suck the breast of its own offspring

text: Ubuso obungethenjwa abungeni.
meaning: People who are untrustworthy are not welcome.
transliteration: A face that cannot be trusted doesn't enter.

text: Ukize ububwa abukubitira abandi
meaning: When people finally get into good moments, they forget those who are struggling. It is used when someone mocks people who are in the situations that they survived.
transliteration: The one who is freed from cowardice cannot tolerate that same weakness in others.

text: Zito huwa jepesi ukilichukua.
meaning: You solve your problems by confronting them.
transliteration: A heavy burden becomes light when you bear it.

text: Moto oyo akumisaka koleka ndelo azali lokola moto oyo akumi matoi.
meaning: Excessive praise can be as ineffective or meaningless as ignoring it.
transliteration: Une personne qui loue excessivement est comme une personne sourde.

text: Kunyanya kusevesa sadza, unozopedzisira wotemura.
meaning: Being wasteful or careless deprives one of resources that could have been available for use in the future.
transliteration: Eating up the relish too fast will leave you with no relish for the sadza.

text: Amaano waa labada madax, dhexdhexaadna waa buuq.
meaning: Illustrates the fragile nature of trust and the potential for betrayal to disrupt relationships.
transliteration: Trust is like the two ends of a stick, betrayal is its knot.

text: Bul xeeb nit ndax tuutaayam.
meaning: Respect everyone equally.
transliteration: Do not look down on a person because of how small they are.

text: Ukukhula kwebhinqa kukuba umliba.
meaning: Leaders should strive for personal and communal growth, symbolized here by the fattening of a pig.
transliteration: The growth of a pig is to become fat.

text: Ẹrú kan, ni í mú'ni bú igba ẹrú
meaning: An indiscretion of one, invariably smears all
transliteration: It's one slave that would cause two hundred others to be reproved

text: Achi nan fiiga / achi naariani jedhe waraabessi
meaning: To comfort oneself by putting down one's opponents.
transliteration: "There I will run. There they chased me," said the hyena.

text: Sekan nyɛ nam a, nyɛ sɛ yɛde retwa nku.
meaning: Everyone has something they can achieve.
transliteration: If a knife is blunt, it is not when it is being used to cut shea butter.

text: ቀን ቢረዝም ልብ ያደክም
meaning: Long periods of hardship or stress can wear down even the strongest of spirits.
transliteration: Even if the day is long, the heart is tired.

text: Muusuuru e anndi to wasata bu’a
meaning: There is a limit to what one does even as a habit
transliteration: The cat knows where it can dig and defecate

text: Neman kudi makahon ciniki.
meaning: In business, you gain and lose
transliteration: Business is a blind bargain

text: Taa bụ maka mpịwa akịdị, echi ga-abụ maka osisi m oriri ya.
meaning: One should endeavour to work and take some rest for tomorrow is another day.
transliteration: Today is for harvesting the African beans while tomorrow is for cooking and eating it.

text: Inhlonipho ingasishintsha isilwane.
meaning: Treating others with respect can influence their behavior positively.
transliteration: Respect can change an animal.

text: Ibyinyo biseka ibindi bizabisanga
meaning: Do not laugh people who are suffering because it can happen to you
transliteration: The big teeth that laugh at similar teeth will go together

text: Ulicho nacho mkononi mwako ndicho chako.
meaning: Consider what you have as your own, do not count what you are planning to have before you do because it might not materialize.
transliteration: What you have laid your hands on is what is yours.

text: Alobi mabele moko amona nkwa
meaning: This proverb suggests that a single effort might not be sufficient to solve a problem or achieve a goal.
transliteration: Un doigt seul ne peut attraper les puces.
