text: Mapudzi anowira kusina hari.
meaning: Good things evade those who need them, and are presented to those who are blind to, or have no use for them.
transliteration: Those who have an abundance of squashes have no pots.

text: Yaa dhashay buqdaan oo isugu jiray?.
meaning: Questioning the root causes of poverty.
transliteration: Who created the poor and their poverty?.

text: pechum lirr. bu neheh yai jaa tiyeh si mbaga ya.
meaning: success is achieved with a good support system.
transliteration: If a baby dances well its because of the mother holding unto its shoulders.

text: Ukufunda kuyaqhubekeka.
meaning: It emphasizes the lifelong nature of learning and personal development.
transliteration: Learning is continuous.

text: Bí kò sí àkópọ̀, kí lewúrẹ́ wá dé ìṣọ̀ adìyẹ
meaning: A major set back can be humbling
transliteration: Were it not that the animals (for sales) had been packed together, what would goats be doing in the chicken's stall?

text: Haron qaa haramu qaallu olla salpha
meaning: Familiarity breeds contempt
transliteration:
(As) a pond in the valley (so) the seer (community leader) in a
backward village is taken lightly

text: Nyansa bebrebe ma ɔman bɔ.
meaning: If you are too clever, you fail.
transliteration: Too much wisdom spoils the state.

text: ልብ የሚገኝ በስልሳ፣ ገንዘብ የሚገኝ በሰላሳ
meaning: As individuals age, priorities shift from wealth accumulation to embracing heartfelt connections
transliteration: sixty harbors a heart, and thirty holds a wealth.

text: Yi’ataa nyiiwa dow hoore muuɗum, maa tennga dow hoore goɗɗo
meaning: To ignore your problem and be concerned about the problem of others
transliteration: You do not see the elephant on your head, but see the louse on some’s head

text: Gammon rama, ba ya warwarewa.
meaning: A strong bond
transliteration: Head support made of jute branches is hard to loosen.

text: A dịghị akarị nwanadi akarị kama ọ bụ ahụ ka a na- akatara ya.
meaning: What brings joy is not having an enemy but knowing how to stay with him.
transliteration: Nobody can outgrow having detractors, the only way out is to know how to manage them.

text: Ukufa akunakugwenywa.
meaning: Death is a natural part of life
transliteration: Death is inevitable

text: Agahuru gakomeye kiyima umupfu
meaning: Careful people avoid danger
transliteration: A strong bush avoids the dead

text: Aso maliki si fundi.
meaning: It suggests that possessing the right equipment is essential for demonstrating true expertise or craftsmanship in a particular field. Without the proper tools, even a skilled worker may struggle to achieve the desired outcome.
transliteration: One who does not own the tool is not a skilled worker.

text: Kolona nzete te, kolona nzela.
meaning: Focus on creating opportunities and setting a direction for success.
transliteration: Ne plantez pas un arbre, plantez un chemin.

text: Tenda dzose pwere, hapana asiri munhu.
meaning: One should not discriminate against someone because they regard them as being of lesser worth.
transliteration: Accept all children, there is no one who is less worthy.

text: Ninkii rag iyo dumar ahi ka hadlay, ka hadalkooda dhalinyaro ayaa lahaa.
meaning: The impact of promoting gender equality in shaping the perspectives of the younger generation.
transliteration: The one who spoke of men and women equally, his words influenced the youth.

text: Kiñaan fanqul muur, Yàllaay maye.
meaning: What is yours will be yours.
transliteration: Jealousy cannot break that which God gives you.

text: Ubuso bumnandi bubonakala emehlweni.
meaning: A person's true nature is revealed through their actions.
transliteration: A good face is seen in the eyes.

text: A kì í gbin ẹ̀pà sí oko ikún
meaning: Do not expose your assets to obvious risks
transliteration: Grundnuts ought not to be planted on the ground squirrel's farm (since squirrels eats them)

text: Bilisa maddi dhawan male / isa hindhawan
meaning: A free man has rights that cannot be denied.
transliteration: They hit a free man (on) his cheek, otherwise they do not hit him completely.

text: Ɔnammɔn ne asɛm.
meaning: The difficulty is to start a project.
transliteration: A step is the problem.

text: እኔ ለብቻዬ ጥረቴ፣ ካንተ ጋር ድካሜ
meaning: Each person has their own strengths and weaknesses.
transliteration: Although a man, when with others, he's not always capable of what another man can do.

text: Mo eeraayi maayo jalataa mo nooda ŋati
meaning: You must not celebrate someone’s misfortune
transliteration: The person yet to cross the river cannot laugh one bitten by a crocodile

text: Ba fada da malam ba, asiri ake tsoro.
meaning: The aftermath of a daring act is scary
transliteration: You're not scared of fighting a voodoo man, it's his charms you're scared of

text: Nsogbu dịka akpa, onye ọbụla ko nke ya, ma nke onye adịghị ezuru ya.
meaning: Everyone has his own life challenges
transliteration: Problems are like bags, everyone is carrying his. But a person is never content with his.

text: Ukwenza intambo ibe nkulu lapho iphuka khona.
meaning: Encouraging perseverance and resilience in difficult times, emphasizing the need to strengthen oneself in the face of challenges.
transliteration: Making the rope thicker at the breaking point.

text: Aho inyundo iciye kabiri, haba hari ubuce
meaning: "Persistence brings victory". It is used when you want to show that persistence can be productive.
transliteration: Where a hammer strikes twice, there are shreds/bits and pieces.

text: Ngoma ya mchawi haiwahi kuwa tupu.
meaning: There is always something going on or brewing.
transliteration: The medicine man's drum is never empty.

text: Ntango moto azali na matoi minene, tosengeli koboya kolobela yango.
meaning: Learn from others' mistakes and experiences. Apprenez des erreurs et des expériences des autres.
transliteration: When someone has large ears, we should avoid discussing it. Quand quelqu'un a de grandes oreilles, nous devrions éviter d'en discuter.

text: Bere zvarakatya, mapapata aro mangani?
meaning: Sometimes it is better to retreat and seem cowardly, than walk right into the face of danger.
transliteration: Since the hyena was afraid, how many were its skeletal bones?

text: Ninkii daalay waa la daaliyaa.
meaning: Caution against expecting too much from a generous act.
transliteration: He who lends is not as generous as he seems.

text: Mbooloo mooy doole.
meaning: When you unite you are powerful.
transliteration: Unity is strength.

text: Uthando luyaphela, icala luyakhala.
meaning: Even after love fades, the memories or consequences endure.
transliteration: Love ends, but the story remains.

text: Olókùnrùn tó jẹ iyán ogójì, tòun tiwọn ní ńre ogun.
meaning: One cannot have a healthy appetite and also complain of ill health.
transliteration: The invalid who eats pounded yams worth 40 cowries: both he and the warriors will head for the war.

text: Ofiyyu hinolchun niiti ko olcha jedhe wadali harre
meaning: One accepts reality and acts for oneself first
transliteration:
"Even I cannot save myself (from the hyena). Can I save my wife?"
said the jackass

text: Ampasakyi se: “Mewɔ ni a, anka mente sɛɛ”.
meaning: An orphan suffers / if you have no destiny helper you suffer.
transliteration: The vulture says: “if I had a mother then I would not be like this”.

text: አህያም የለኝ ከጅብ አልጣላ
meaning: Without certain elements, there are no related problems.
transliteration: I don't have a donkey; I don't have a hyena.

text: Cobbal ɗoftii kosam
meaning: The expected has happened
transliteration: Cobbal has gone to bid  sour milk farewell

text: Ɗirkaniya, mota a randa.
meaning: This is in reference to some action or event conducted irrationally, thus, done without thinking.
transliteration: Confusion, car in a water pot.

text: Anụ gbala taa, e chi bụ nta
meaning: Each day is with new opportunities. We should keep hope alive
transliteration: When an animal ran away today, tomorrow is hunting

text: Umlomo uvuleka ngezandla.
meaning: Implies that one should be cautious about what they say, as words can lead to trouble.
transliteration: The mouth opens with the hands.

text: Itegeko rirusha ibuye kuremera
meaning: Laws are so powerful and should be followed. It is used to remind people to do the right things not because they want to but because they are forced by the law.
transliteration: The law is heavier than the stones

text: Bora kuwa mwiba kwa upande wa rafiki yako kuliko sauti yake ya mwangwi.
meaning: A real friend should warn a friend in case of wrongdoing.
transliteration: It is better to be the thorn in the side of your friend than to be your friend's echo.

text: Kobalana na nzete ya mbila, koyekola kotonga.
meaning: suggests being prepared to adapt and integrate with new circumstances or environments.
transliteration: Épouse un palmier, apprends à tisser.

text: Igaroziva kuti mhanza yembudzi iri mumabvi.
meaning: Everybody should be able to understand what is obvious.
transliteration: It is common knowledge that the baldness of a goat is on the knees.

text: Guduud la noolaa ma guuxo.
meaning: Encourages humility and gratitude for what is provided.
transliteration: One does not boast of being fed within the fence.

text: Ni ñuy def saa njëkk kenn du ko def saa béjjén.
meaning: People are more inclined to exploit the vulnerable while showing restraint when dealing with the strong.
transliteration: That which one dares to do to a sheep without horns, one would never think of doing to a ram with horns.

text: Inkosi ithi bayede, kwakhwa elwandle.
meaning: Even powerful individuals face peril or vulnerability.
transliteration: The chief said "Bayede," drowned in the sea.

text: A kì í pé kí ọmọdé má fẹ ehín gan-gan-ran bó bá tù ú; ètè ni kò rí fi bò ó.
meaning: Do not force people to act against their nature.
transliteration: One does not order a child not to expose his buckteeth if doing to soothes him; what he lacks are enough lips to cover them.

text: dhama'I kan jedheen abjuudhaan bachaa bula.
meaning: Those destined for hard work will often feel its burden even in their dreams.
transliteration: One whom God has destined to labor will find himself bearing the weight in his dreams.

text: Mmɔborɔ bɔ wo a, na ɛfiri w’anamɔn.
meaning: If you do not disturb a person, he does not harm you.
transliteration: If a wasp stings you, it is because of your footsteps.

text: ሀሜተኛ ያፍራል ሀስተኛ ይረታል
meaning: The proverb suggests that a gossiper will feel ashamed and that lying ultimately leads to loss or defeat.
transliteration: A gossiper will be ashamed. A liar will be looser

text: Moye fuu maggii puccu suuno jippoto wuro semteende
meaning: Greed is a shameful act at any point
transliteration: Anybody who rides on a horse of greed will disembark in the home of shame

text: Bari ba shegiya ba ce (da ubanta, wai shi da-na-sani)
meaning: When you don't heed advice, you regret
transliteration: Stop! isn't a bastard, it's father is regret

text: Oge ọbula m p̣utara mgbá mmiri ezobe.
meaning: It takes a very careful person to trace the source of certain hidden phenomenon.
transliteration: How is it that whenever I come out for wrestling, the next thing is for rain to begin to fall.

text: Inkani ifana nokugula, ibeka umuntu ukugula.
meaning: Being stubborn is harmful.
transliteration: Stubbornness is like a sickness, it puts one ill.

text: Nta muhanuzi mu babo
meaning: No one can guess the future. It is used when a brilliant person is doubted by people around her/him.
transliteration: No prophet is recognized by his/her own people

text: Mmegee paka, wewe mkono huna.
meaning: Telling people what to do, but doing nothing oneself. Don't tell others to do when you can do it.
transliteration: Break it up for the cat, don't you have a hand?

text: Noseki akoki ko sila kasi mabini ekanama ekotikala
meaning: Joyful times and relationships may come to an end, but destiny prevails.
transliteration: The laughter may fade, but fate remains.

text: Ukama igasva, hunozadziswa nekudya.
meaning: Be hospitable.
transliteration: Kinship is half full, it is made full by eating.

text: Ninna kuma arag, ninna ma arka.
meaning: Ignoring something doesn't mean it's not visible to others; consequences are inevitable.
transliteration: He who does not see it, others do not see him.

text: Kula mak opa la sagarr.
meaning: With age comes experience.
transliteration: A person older than you has more rags than you.

text: Ukufa kukaMnguni, kuzoba mnandi.
meaning: Indicates relief or improvement after the removal of a negative or oppressive force.
transliteration: The death of Mnguni will be sweet.

text: Egbò-ó kẹ̀, iná kẹ̀, ohùn èèyàn-án kẹ̀.
meaning: The unrelenting misbehavior of others necessitates one's continuous admonition.
transliteration: The ulcer grows bigger, the fire glows redder, and one's voice grows hoarse.

text: Namni bor ili badduu har’a dugdaan deema
meaning: A person often brings problems upon himself
transliteration: The person who will lose his eyes tomorrow, walks backwards today.

text: Onipa fidie, yɛsum a, yɛkata so.
meaning: If a person wants to damage another, he does it by hidden means.
transliteration: A human trap is covered after it is set up.

text: ከዝግጅቱ በኋላ መፀፀት ምን ፋይዳ አለው?
meaning: Dwelling on past mistakes or missed opportunities serves no purpose for growth or progress.
transliteration: What good is regret after the event?

text: Gooto mo sollaare
meaning: One person equals to many people in terms of ability
transliteration: One person with dust

text: Gani ga wane ya ishi wane tsoron Allah
meaning: Learning from the mistakes of others
transliteration: Seeing what happens to someone is enough for another to fear God

text: Onye anụ ehi eruteghi, ọ sị na anụ bụ aja aja
meaning: One who did not do something will begin to criticize that thing
transliteration: He that does not have access for a beef says that there is enough meet

text: Umuntu uyajabula ngesihlahla asitshalile.
meaning: Take pride in your accomplishments and investments.
transliteration: A person rejoices in the tree they have planted

text: Amagara araseseka ntayorwa!
meaning: You should take care of yourself/Do not play with your health.
transliteration: When health spills it can not be picked up.

text: Mtu maskini ni kama ndama yatima.
meaning: Both have to survive in bad times.
transliteration: A poor man is like an orphaned ram.

text: Nyongo ya pongi suka se ofuta.
meaning: We are encouraged to care of one's well-being. You can’t pile up problems because in the end they can kill
transliteration: The debt of sleep needs to be paid.

text: Nyika vanhu.
meaning: The success of a nation depends on the effort of its people.
transliteration: Country is people.

text: Dhiig islaan ma qarsoomo.
meaning: This proverb conveys the idea that harm or conflict within a family or close-knit community has lasting consequences.
transliteration: A wound on a relative does not heal.

text: Waacha ma, maa daan orut, ku daan dangai feteh kow
meaning: victory has to be clear.
transliteration: get off me I won already, isn't safe . The victor has to be on top.

text: Isinqumo sesomntu omnye qha.
meaning: Each individual must take responsibility for their choices.
transliteration: A decision is for one person only.

text: Abẹ̀wẹ̀ ńwá ọ̀tá fúnra ẹ̀.
meaning: It is best to be self-sufficient.
transliteration: He who summons others to render him communal help seeks enemies.

text: Gowwaa fi dhagaan wal rukutanii, gooftaa fi garbichi wal falmanii.
meaning: Conflict or misunderstanding often arises between those of different status or understanding.
transliteration: The fool and the stone struck each other, the master and the slave argued.

text: Ɔnammɔn mmutu kwa.
meaning: There is a cause for any unusual action.
transliteration: The sole of the foot does not turn over for no reason.

text: ለሚመለከት ለሚያየው ሞት ቅርብ ነው።
meaning: Death feels imminent or close to those who are aware or perceptive.
transliteration: Death is near to the beholder.

text: Nano loota nyaamo, nyaamo loota nano
meaning: To help one another
transliteration: Left hand to wash the right hand, right hand to wash left hand

text: Dokin da-na-sani ba shi da gudu.
meaning: You can't progress when you dwell in regrets
transliteration: The horse of regret doesn't run fast.

text: Aṅụ sị na ihe kpatara ya ji eme mkpọtụ tupu ya abanye n'uji bụ ka anụ bi n'uji bido n' oge zọba isi onwe ya
meaning: Somebody that has been informed should not be caught by surprise
transliteration: A bee said that why he makes noise when he wants to enter inside a crack is because the animals that live in the crack will begin to run for their life

text: Ukubona akwenziwa lutho.
meaning: Observation alone doesn’t accomplish anything
transliteration: Seeing is nothing done

text: Ikinyoma gihaka umugabo imyaka ibiri
meaning: Regardless of how long you tell lies, the truth will eventually come out
transliteration: A lie will keep a man for two years

text: Huwezi kuwa na vyote, chagua amani yako.
meaning: Prioritize inner peace and tranquility.
transliteration: You cannot have everything, choose your peace.

text: Mokili oyo ezali esika ya etumba
meaning: Life is full of challenges and struggles, likening the world to a battleground where individuals must continually face obstacles.
transliteration: Ce monde est un champ de bataille.
